1.text: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our beloved fellow worker,

2.text: to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church that meets at your house:

3.text: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.text: I always thank my God, remembering you in my prayers,

5.text: because I hear about your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints.

6.text: I pray that your partnership in the faith may become effective as you fully acknowledge every good thing that is ours in Christ.

7.text: I take great joy and encouragement in your love, because you, brother, have refreshed the hearts of the saints.

8.text: So although in Christ I am bold enough to order you to do what is proper,

9.text: I prefer to appeal on the basis of love. For I, Paul, am now aged, and a prisoner of Christ Jesus as well.

10.text: I appeal to you for my child Onesimus, whose father I became while I was in chains.

11.text: Formerly he was useless to you, but now he has become useful both to you and to me.

12.text: I am sending back to you him who is my very heart.

13.text: I would have liked to keep him with me, so that on your behalf he could minister to me in my chains for the gospel.

14.text: But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your goodness will not be out of compulsion, but by your own free will.

15.text: For perhaps this is why he was separated from you for a while, so that you might have him back for good—

16.text: no longer as a slave, but better than a slave, as a beloved brother. He is especially beloved to me, but even more so to you, both in person and in the Lord.

17.text: So if you consider me a partner, receive him as you would receive me.

18.text: But if he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge it to my account.

19.text: I, Paul, write this with my own hand. I will repay it—not to mention that you owe me your very self.

20.text: Yes, brother, let me have some benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.

21.text: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.

22.text: In the meantime, prepare a guest room for me, because I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

23.text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings,

24.text: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
